title: Augusta County: N. Sargent to Alexander H. H. Stuart, October 24, 1859
summary: Sargent discusses ex-Whig hopes to nominate a candidate for the 1860 presidential election in hopes of influencing the Republican's selection of a canidate in the race. Sargent also discusses the political effects of Brown's raid at Harper's Ferry, and asks for Stuart's opinions on the matters.
keywords: National Government, State Government, American Civil War
